node.title: US astronauts complete spacewalk to replace antenna after debris scare
node.alt: Astronaut on a spacewalk, fixing an antenna.
node.description: The spacewalk, which came a month after Russia destroyed an old satellite in a missile test,Â was initially delayed over fears of orbiting debris.
node.content: ["Spacewalking astronauts have replaced a broken antenna outside the International Space Station after getting NASA's advice they were safe from orbiting debris.", "US astronauts Tom Marshburn\u00a0and Lieutenant Commander Kayla Barron were supposed to complete the job on Tuesday, but NASA delayed the spacewalk because of potentially threatening space junk.", "NASA later determined the astronauts were safe to go out on Thursday, despite a slightly increased risk of a punctured suit from satellite wreckage.", "Soon after the spacewalk ended, however, Mission Control notified the crew the station would need to move into a slightly lower orbit on Friday to avoid an old US rocket fragment.", "Last month, Russia destroyed an old satellite in a missile test.", "NASA is not saying whether that event was the source of the junk that delayed the spacewalk.", "During the first National Space Council meeting under US Vice-President Kamala Harris this week, top government officials joined her in condemning Russia's extensive debris-scattering last month.", "More than 1,700 sizable pieces of the shattered satellite are being tracked, possibly hundreds of thousands too small to see.", "Lieutenant Commander Barron\u00a0reported at least 11 small debris strikes to the failed antenna that was removed during the spacewalk, with some of the holes looking old.", "The device,\u00a0which has been in use for more than 20 years,\u00a0malfunctioned in September.", "Mr Marshburn, a 61-year-old a flight engineer on the space station, became the oldest person to conduct a spacewalk.", "It was the fourth of his career while it was the first for Lieutenant Commander Barron, a 34-year-old space rookie.", "They flew up on SpaceX last month for a six-month stay.", "Two other Americans are aboard the space station, along with two Russians and one German.", "AP"]
